comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content:
Broadway performer, daughter of a Denver judge named TB Stuart.

In 1913, she was in the news because she was suing a man named Henry G. Williams, who had apparently promised to marry her (conveniently leaving out the detail that he was already married--but then, so was Maida Athens at the time).  She lost the case.   Two weeks after the case was dismissed, Ruth L. Stuart Trufant, aka Maida Athens, died from poisoning, in April 1914.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: See obituary in New-York tribune., April 27, 1914, Page 14, column 4
